messages.subject: Re: Crime and punishment
messages.msgSnippet: At home, where I come from, if you made a mistake, you always had a chance to make it better, Lorenz said. How do you learn if you get beat up and spit
messages.messageBody:
''At home, where I come from, if you made a mistake, you always had a
chance to make it better,'' Lorenz said. ''How do you learn if you get
beat up and spit out for what you did?''

I like this quote from the article.
Mary Ellen
Seek joy in what you give, not in what you get.

messages.subject: Re: Crime and punishment
messages.msgSnippet: Here is another site to answer questions regarding how many people are incarcerated in the United States compared to other countries....per 100,000. Quite
messages.messageBody:
Here is another site to answer questions regarding how many people are
incarcerated in the United States compared to other countries....per 100,000.
Quite shocking really. We will hit 2,000,000 prisoners in February of 2000. We
are world leaders. We share the honors or shame with Russia, Ukraine, Singapore
and South Africa.

http://hr95.org/hr95faces.html#incarceration

When you get to the site scroll down and see how we are doing. One might wonder
whether there might be a problem here that bears looking at.



best wishes
Joel

messages.subject: Crime and punishment
messages.msgSnippet: I would urge anyone interested in an alternate view of justice to read the following article.  It gives an example of how restorative justice can be applied to
messages.messageBody:
I would urge anyone interested in an alternate view of justice to read
the following article. It gives an example of how restorative justice
can be applied to criminal problems. I, as you might imagine, believe
that these same methods can be used for offenders with much more serious
offenses too. In any case if the topic interests you check it out.

<http://www.boston.com/dailyglobe2/331/metro/Justice_gets_a_fresh_look+.shtml>

--
best wishes
Joel
